alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:57AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Smith, Phillips, Franklin, Phelps, Kearney, Furnas and Harlan Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 157 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kearney to near Hildreth to near Republican City to 8 miles south of Wilsonville. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Alma, Hildreth, Wilcox, Republican City and Huntley around 200 AM CDT. Harlan County Dam around 205 AM CDT. Upland, Naponee and Bloomington around 210 AM CDT. Minden around 215 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Norman, Riverton, Campbell and Smith Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
